Margaret Robertson was born at 41 Fitzroy Road, Primrose Hill, London on 1 March 1882. Her father, Henry Robert Robertson, was an artist of Scottish extraction and Her mother, Agnes Lucy Turner, was a descendant of Robert Chamberlain, who founded the china works of Chamberlain & Son at Worcester (which later became Royal Worcester), and her mother's relatives included John Davidson (traveller), the African explorer, and George Fownes, both of whom were Fellows of the Royal Society. Her paternal grandfather had a private school in Slough.Agnes Arber, 1879–1960 Hamshaw Thomas H Biogr. Mems Fell. R. Soc. 1960 6 1–11; DOI: 10.1098/rsbm.1960.0021. Published 1 November 1960 Retrieved 5 March 2018 http://rsbm.royalsocietypublishing.org/content/roybiogmem/6/1.full.pdf https://www.museumofroyalworcester.org/learning/research/factories/kerr-binns/
